noun.description: A substance used to stimulate the production of antibodies and provide immunity against one or several diseases, prepared from the causative agent of a disease, its products, or a synthetic substitute, treated to act as an antigen without inducing the disease.
examples: there is no vaccine against the virus

origin: Late 18th century: from Latin vaccinus, from vacca cow (because of the early use of the cowpox virus against smallpox).
